ProvisioningStep.Description: Determine if the request is for a new VPC in a new AWS account from the inventory or a new VPC in an account that is already in use.
Sends an edu.emory.Network.VpnConnectionProfileAssignment.Generate-Request to get assigned the next available VpnConnectionProfileAssignment.

Sends an edu.emory.Network.VpnConnectionProfile.Query-Request to retrieve the VpnConnectionProfile it has been assigned and get the VPC's assigned CIDR range. Then this step executes the subnetting algorithm and stores the results as step properties.
Collect parameters from configuration and the VPCP object and send a com.amazom.aws.Provisioning.Stack.Generate-Request for the emory-aws-rs-account-cfn stack.
Collect parameters from configuration and the VPCP object and send a com.amazom.aws.Provisioning.Stack.Generate-Request for the emory-aws-vpc-type1-cfn stack.
If this is a new account, send a edu.emory.LightweightDirectoryService.OrganizationUnit.Create-Request to create the new LDS ou for the account.
If this is a new account, send a edu.emory.LightweightDirectoryService.Group.Create-Request to create the new LDS group for the RHEDcloudAdministratorRole.
If this is a new account, send a edu.emory.LightweightDirectoryService.Group.Create-Request to create the new LDS group for the RHEDcloudAdministratorRole.
If this is a new account, send a edu.emory.LightweightDirectoryService.Group.Create-Request to create the new LDS group for the RHEDcloudCentralAdministratorRole.
If this is a new account, send a edu.emory.Identity.Role.Generate-Request to create the new NetID role and resources for the RHEDcloudAdministratorRole
If this is a new account, send a edu.emory.Identity.Role.Generate-Request to create the new NetID role and resources for the RHEDcloudAuditorRole

If the request is for a new account, invoke the send an AccountProvisioningAuthorization query request to determine if the user is authorized. If the request is for a new VPC in an existing account, perform a RoleAssignment.Query-Request to determine if the user is an administrator of the existing account.
If this is a new account, send a edu.emory.Identity.Role.Generate-Request to create the new NetID role and resources for the RHEDcloudCentralAdministratorRole
If this is a new account, send a edu.emory.Identity.RoleAssignment.Generate-Request to assign the LITS Central Administrator group to the RHEDcloudCentralAdministratorRole
If this is a new account, send a edu.emory.Identity.RoleAssignment.Generate-Request to assign the users specified in the requisition to the RHEDcloudAdministratorRole
If this is a new account, send a edu.emory.Identity.RoleAssignment.Generate-Request to assign the users specified in the requisition to the RHEDcloudAdministratorRole
If this is a new account, send a com.amazon.aws.Provisioning.SamlProvider.Create-Request to create the SAML provider.
If this is a new account, send a com.amazon.aws.Provisioning.AccountAlias.Create-Request to create the account alias.
Send a com.amazon.aws.Provisioning.VirtualPrivateCloud.Create-Request to create the VPC metadata object.
Send a edu.emory.Network.VpnConnectionProfileAssignment.Update-Request to reassign the VpnConnectionProfile from this ProvisioningId to the VpcId of the new VPC.
Send a edu.emory.Network.VpnConnection.Generate-Request to generate the VPN connection and wait the maxWaitTime for the status to complete or fail.
Send a com.amazon.aws.Provisioning.AccountNotification.Create-Request with a type of VPCP which will force and e-mail message to be sent to each user's e-mail address as well.
If a new account is needed, increment the account sequence number and return it as a property.

Verify that there is an aws-admin-n@emory.edu for the new n, where n is the account sequence number by sending an edu.emory.Network.EmailAddressValidation.Query-Request to the E-mail Address Validation Service. If validation fails, fail the step.

Verify that there is an aws-billing-n@emory.edu for the new n, where n is the account sequence number by sending an edu.emory.Network.EmailAddressValidation.Query-Request to the E-mail Address Validation Service. If validation fails, fail the step.

If this is a new account, count the number of aws-admin-n@emory.edu and aws-billing-n@emory.edu distribution lists left in their inventories by sending an edu.emory.Network.EmailAddressValidation.Query-Request to the E-mail Address Validation Service for every n greater than the current sequence number until and invalid e-mail address is reached. If the count of remaining distribution lists in the inventory is equal to or less than the alert threshold, log and error and create a ServiceNow Incident informing the messaging team that the inventory is nearly depleted.
If a new account is needed, send an com.amazon.aws.Provisioning.Account.Generate-Request to the AWS Account Service to generate a new account.
Send a com.amazom.aws.Provisioning.AccountOrganizationMembership.Create-Request place it in the Administration organization for provisioning.
If this is a new account, send a com.amazom.aws.Provisioning.Account.Create-Request to register account metadata.
Determine if the request is for a new VPC in a new AWS account from the inventory or a new VPC in an account that is already in use.
Sends an edu.emory.Network.VpnConnectionProfileAssignment.Generate-Request to get assigned the next available VpnConnectionProfileAssignment.

If the request is for a new VPC in an existing account, perform a RoleAssignment.Query-Request to determine if the user is an administrator of the existing account.
If this is a new account, send a edu.emory.Identity.Role.Generate-Request to create the new NetID role and resources for the RHEDcloudCentralAdministratorRole
If this is a new account, send a edu.emory.Identity.RoleAssignment.Generate-Request to assign the LITS Central Administrator group to the RHEDcloudCentralAdministratorRole
If this is a new account, send a edu.emory.Identity.RoleAssignment.Generate-Request to assign the users specified in the requisition to the RHEDcloudAdministratorRole

Send a edu.emory.Network.VpnConnection.Generate-Request to generate the VPN connection and wait the maxWaitTime for the status to complete or fail.
Send a com.amazon.aws.Provisioning.AccountNotification.Create-Request with a type of VPCP which will force and e-mail message to be sent to each user's e-mail address as well.
If a new account is needed, increment the account sequence number and return it as a property.

Verify that there is an aws-billing-n@emory.edu for the new n, where n is the account sequence number by sending an edu.emory.Network.EmailAddressValidation.Query-Request to the E-mail Address Validation Service. If validation fails, fail the step.

If the count of remaining distribution lists in the inventory is equal to or less than the alert threshold, log and error and create a ServiceNow Incident informing the messaging team that the inventory is nearly depleted.
If a new account is needed, send an com.amazon.aws.Provisioning.Account.Generate-Request to the AWS Account Service to generate a new account.
Send a com.amazom.aws.Provisioning.AccountOrganizationMembership.Create-Request place it in the Administration organization for provisioning.
If this is a new account, send a com.amazom.aws.Provisioning.Account.Create-Request to register account metadata.
